meanings.definition: To oversee or direct (someone or something)
meanings.sent1: She is supervising the children at the playground.
meanings.sent2: The manager is supervising the construction project.
meanings.sent3: The cat thinks it is supervising the birds outside.
meanings.sent4: The sun supervising the growth of the plants in the garden.
meanings.sent5: He was supervising the ants as they carried food to their nest.

meanings.definition: To watch over and direct (an activity or process)
meanings.sent1: The teacher is supervising the students during the exam.
meanings.sent2: The lifeguard is supervising the swimmers in the pool.
meanings.sent3: The robot is supervising the toaster to make sure it doesn't burn the toast.
meanings.sent4: The moon supervising the tides as they ebb and flow.
meanings.sent5: She was supervising the production line to ensure everything ran smoothly.

meanings.definition: The action or process of overseeing or directing someone or something
meanings.sent1: His supervising of the project led to its successful completion.
meanings.sent2: The company's supervising of employee training is thorough.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's supervising of the city's safety is never-ending.
meanings.sent4: The mountain's supervising of the valley below is majestic.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's supervising of the classroom created a positive learning environment.
